DataElement.preferredName: Person Right Arm Angle Between Lateral Chest Wall And Humerus Joint Mobility Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric annotation to indicate right arm joint mobility of the angle between the lateral chest wall and humerus, measured in degrees.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Right Arm Angle Between Lateral Chest Wall And Humerus Range of Motion
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the wrist and located on the right side of the body._The inclination of one line to another or the plane of one object to another._The space or interval separating two things._Situated at or extending to the side._The total system of structures outside the lungs that move as a part of breathing; it includes all structures from the skin to the parietal pleura._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._The upper arm bone between the shoulder and elbow._A measure of joint flexibility consisting of flexion, how far it can bend, and extension, how far it can stretch. It is usually measured by the number of degrees from the starting position of a segment to its position at the end of its arc.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the wrist and located on the right side of the body.
The inclination of one line to another or the plane of one object to another.
The space or interval separating two things.
Situated at or extending to the side.
The total system of structures outside the lungs that move as a part of breathing; it includes all structures from the skin to the parietal pleura.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
The upper arm bone between the shoulder and elbow.

A measure of joint flexibility consisting of flexion, how far it can bend, and extension, how far it can stretch. It is usually measured by the number of degrees from the starting position of a segment to its position at the end of its arc.
